entry.title: dotnet/efcore - Issues & Pull Requests - 2023-10-09
entry.content:
Issues

Created

  • More information in TagWithCallSite #32003
  • Migration bundles directly to a docker container #31999
  • Microsoft.Data.Sqlite with nhibernate - update Schema not working #31998
  • Migrations bundle add a paramter to select the used schema #31997

Closed

  • Insert trigger breaks SaveChanges #31985
  • Treat SQL Server Error Number 1222 as Transient (Lock request time out period exceeded) #31724
    8.0.0
  • When using SqlServerRetryingExecutionStrategy, on retry exception thrown #31000
    8.0.0
  • Table-sharing synthesized concurrency tokens are not created in all cases #29750
    8.0.0
  • NullReferenceException when accessing navigation property with compiled models and ambiguous type names #31977
  • Generated SQL has syntax issue when doing GroupJoin with Union constructed and ordered query #31580
    7.0.0
  • Enforcing usage of FluentAPI instead of attributes #31889
  • Test execution strategies when using System.Transactions #31834
  • Native AOT - Microsoft.Data.SQLite - Statically Link / self contained EXE #31829
  • TPC does not work "out of the box" with Sqlite #31752
  • Data inconsistency while loading entities based on new changed prop before SaveChangesInterceptor.SavingChangesAsync #31741
  • Changing the result after reader executed in a DbCommandInterceptor #31991

PullRequests

Created

  • Add member name param to TagWithCallSite #32002
  • [release/8.0] Fix to #31961 - Projection filtering on second-level reference could not be translated #31996
    Servicing-approved

Merged

  • [release/8.0] Treat SQL Pool warmup/pause errors as transient #31739
    Servicing-approved, community-contribution
  • [release/8.0] Open the connection before creating the DbCommand #31988
    Servicing-approved
  • [release/8.0] Synthesize concurrency tokens for derived tables in TPC and TPT #31979
    Servicing-approved

Updated

  • Fix lock loosing in concurrency detector for multiple contexts on one thread #31891
